title: Exclusive: OpenAI Used Kenyan Workers on Less Than $2 Per Hour to Make ChatGPT Less Toxic

last_post.content:
There is much undervalued work which goes into the production of AI. Time talks to the workers at Sama in Kenya, who helped remove bias from Chat GPT. The workers saw horrific material, with little provision for mental health, for under $2 an hour. When Sama cancelled the contract, they were left without work.

https://time.com/6247678/openai-chatgpt-kenya-workers/

title: Buffer adds Mastodon to its social media platform

last_post.content:
🚨BIG NEWS🚨

Buffer just added Mastodon as one of its supported social networks!

Amongst social media professionals this is HUGE!

See screenshots!

https://www.coywolf.news/social/buffer-adds-mastodon/

Hey hey! We're still taking down hype in 2023. @emilymbender and I will be live this Friday at 9:30 AM PT to chat General Purpose AI models (as a service) and other #FreshAIHell.

We'll be at twitch.tv/KateSilver538, and check out our past episodes over at PeerTube https://videos.trom.tf/w/p/4gykGcMrmHHs7bG2Y6qK9W

“I want to talk about the growing and thriving developer community that is fully embracing Mastodon and the potential of the decentralized protocol. To paint a picture of why this is such a big deal, you also have to understand how much of a hassle it has been over the last decade to build anything on top of the Twitter API. It was especially hard to see as a long-time employee.” https://paulstamatiou.com/mastodon/

Well, fuck. The GPT disinformation age is now.

I googled "OS for 4gb ram" and the first hit, which also was used by google to populate its snippet is an answer from quora which is very obviously created with #chatgpt (I recognised the non-committal non-answer right away, but it can also be detected by a popular GPT detector).

The user has 98 answers and, you've guessed it, they are all created with GPT.
PLOT TWIST: The questions where also created with GPT!

https://www.quora.com/profile/Heri-Mulyo-Cahyo

#AI

This is a long, wild inside look at the Twitter disaster.

https://www.theverge.com/23551060/elon-musk-twitter-takeover-layoffs-workplace-salute-emoji

#twitter

Marines tricked an Aai designed to detect humans by....not acting normal

title: Standard EBooks : Free Texts : Free Download, Borrow and Streaming : Internet Archive

last_post.content:
Earlier this year, I became aware of STANDARD EBOOKS, a donation-dependent group of edtiors and layout experts who have been doing the amazing work of taking out-of-copyright books, turning them into top-quality ebooks, and then releasing them for free.

Some of the books they've done are in the Internet Archive here:

https://archive.org/details/standardebooks

They're seeking 75 patrons in December to keep themselves afloat, consider donating to this amazing cause.

https://standardebooks.org/ebooks

title: Chapter 2 Error control | Improving Your Statistical Inferences

last_post.content: If you repeatedly perform a hypothesis test when the null hypothesis is true, p-values will randomly drift between 0 and 1, and therefore, if you test often enough, you will always find a significant effect. https://lakens.github.io/statistical_inferences/errorcontrol.html#optionalstopping This is why preregistration is important. You can test multiple times as data comes in, but then you need to adjust the alpha level: https://lakens.github.io/statistical_inferences/sequential.html For a single simulation of the p-values you could get, see:

Turns out robots can't take care of the elderly. A multi-year experiment with several cutting-edge robots designed to provide different sorts of support for elder care shows that robots require as much or more care than the elderly they're supposed to care for. Introducing robots increases the workload if human caregivers. https://www.cornellpress.cornell.edu/book/9781501768040/robots-wont-save-japan/#bookTabs=1 #robot #ElderCare

#MastodonNews Jan 18, 2023

Welcome to the big leagues! Buffer’s popular social media management software can now schedule and post to Mastodon.

Coywolf: Buffer adds Mastodon to its social media management platform >>> https://www.coywolf.news/social/buffer-adds-mastodon/

Companies typically have social media marketing teams, and they rely on software to monitor mentions, schedule posts and analyze engagement... but none have supported Mastodon. That is, until now.

title: 2023 Unconference on Open Scholarship Practices in Education Research

last_post.content:
Registration is open for the Center for Open Science's free virtual Unconference on Open Scholarship Practices in Education Research from March 9-10: https://www.cos.io/unconference

If you’re in education research or teach about open science, this is a nice conference, regardless of your familiarity with open science practices. This conference is how our mixed methods/qualitative open science working group started!

title: Jeffrey Paul: Apple Has Begun Scanning Your Local Image Files Without Consent

last_post.content:
Just as #apple released new Macs, I have to come across this #privacy violation

https://sneak.berlin/20230115/macos-scans-your-local-files-now/

OK, so I just read the Searchtodon retrospective available here;

https://searchtodon.social/Adventures-in-Mastoland.html

and the thing that jumps out at me is that it's yet another example of some white dude doing 'an experiment' to find out things that they could have discovered years earlier by just listening to the various minorities and their work around informed consent, data extraction practices, and so forth.

Nothing about his conclusions is new. Like, I could've told him that five years ago.

And that's the problem.

🚨 Dream job alert 🚨

Lee Rainie is retiring from the Pew Research Center, so they are looking to hire a new Research Director of Internet and Technology. https://pewtrusts.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/CenterExternal/job/Washington-DC-Pew-Research-Center/Research-Director--Internet-and-Technology_R002016

An analysis of 11 online pharmacies selling abortion pills: at least nine use third-party trackers such as Google Analytics to collect and share sensitive data (Jennifer Gollan/ProPublica) https://www.propublica.org/article/websites-selling-abortion-pills-share-sensitive-data-with-google

Excellent reporting here by @perrigo at Time, investigating the work that a Kenyan firm did for OpenAI -- to find and tag text with grisly, toxic content (bestiality, child abuse, and more), the better to keep GPT3 from absorbing this stuff: https://time.com/6247678/openai-chatgpt-kenya-workers

The sums paid were ... *microscopically* small, compared to OpenAI's valuation

"In its quest to make ChatGPT less toxic, OpenAI used outsourced Kenyan laborers earning less than $2 per hour"

title: Creating A Log-Analysis System To Autodetect and Announce Mastodon Scr

last_post.content:
New #blog: Autodetecting and Announcing #Mastodon Scrapers and Crawlers

There've been quite a few #fedisearch issues recently, but the common thread is that there's usually a gap in reporting - they're often live for weeks before people are made aware.

It's not just people's pet projects either, there are other #scrapers active, quietly consuming posts

So, I built a bot to detect and out them so that fedi admins can block as necessary

https://www.bentasker.co.uk/posts/blog/security/autodetecting-and-outing-mastodon-scrapers-with-scrapersnitchbot.html

#infosec #security

The Ursa Major Awards are open for nominations! They're open to everyone, and it's very easy to participate:

https://ursamajorawards.org/nominations.htm

These awards recognize greatness in the realm of art featuring anthropomorphic (a.k.a. furry) characters, and I've got 11 eligible works this year — two magazines, a non-fiction essay, and eight short stories.

List and links provided below...

I've been wanting to write this for a long time now: Pwned or Bot.

"We're all so comprehensively pwned that if an email address *isn't* pwned, there's a good chance it doesn't belong to a real human."

https://www.troyhunt.com/pwned-or-bot/

title: Assistant Professor in Applied Cognitive Psychology (1,0 FTE)

last_post.content:
Job alert: tenure-track Assistant Professorship in Applied Psychology! 📢​

My department at Leiden University is recruiting an Assistant Professor in Applied Cognitive Psychology, with tenure after 1.5 years. Research topics include behavior change and sustainability, and the position includes teaching and coordinating our MSc program. Deadline is 10 February, apply here. 

#GetFediHired #AcademicJobs #Jobs

title: Amazon discontinues charity donation program amid cost cuts

last_post.content:
The AmazonSmile charity donation program is being discontinued as part of Amazon's cost-cutting efforts. The program has donated more than $377 million globally since launching in 2013.

https://www.cnbc.com/2023/01/18/amazon-discontinues-amazonsmile-charity-donation-program-amid-cost-cuts.html
